meanings.definition: Comb-like respiratory organs in certain mollusks.
meanings.sent1: The ctenidia of the clam help it breathe underwater.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the ctenidia of the snail to understand its breathing mechanism.
meanings.sent3: The ctenidia of the oyster decided to take a break from all the breathing.
meanings.sent4: Her ctenidia danced gracefully in the water, like delicate combs catching the light.
meanings.sent5: The ctenidia, like tiny fans, waved gently to oxygenate the mollusk's body.

meanings.sent1: The aquarium displayed various ctenidia from different mollusk species.
meanings.sent2: She counted the ctenidia of the scallops to ensure they were all intact.
meanings.sent3: The ctenidia in the tank whispered secrets to each other late at night.
meanings.sent4: The ctenidia in the ocean swayed together, creating a mesmerizing underwater ballet.
meanings.sent5: The diver marveled at the colorful ctenidia, like a garden of underwater flowers.
